content:
• Tuesday, June 7, 2011
  • AAPL

    Despite a wave of analyst love regarding yesterday's iCloud rollout - "increases the stickiness...

    Despite a wave of analyst love regarding yesterday's iCloud rollout - "increases the stickiness of the AAPL ecosystem;" "prices the cloud offering to drive adoption" - Apple (AAPL -1.3%) is among the day's worst tech performers. The stock has been stuck at $330-$360 throughout most of 2011, and today's weakness brings the price near the low end.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • EGHT

    Internet telecommunications company 8x8 (EGHT +14%) spikes as news its CEO will make an...

    Internet telecommunications company 8x8 (EGHT +14%) spikes as news its CEO will make an appearance on CNBC tomorrow morning, starting the rumor mill that a deal with Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) is to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • IP

    International Paper (IP +1.1%) and Temple-Inland (TIN +42.3%) are in focus after IP's...

    International Paper (IP +1.1%) and Temple-Inland (TIN +42.3%) are in focus after IP's $30.60/share bid was rejected despite being a 46% premium to Monday's closing price. Other packaging and paper stocks rally on calls from bullish analysts that the industry is heading for consolidation: PKG +6.9%, WY +6.2%, BZ +5.6%, KS +4.3%, RKT +3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • NAV

    Despite a 72% jump in profits and raising FY11 earnings projections, higher costs are taking a...

    Despite a 72% jump in profits and raising FY11 earnings projections, higher costs are taking a bite out of truck maker Navistar (NAV -5.42%) as it transitions from using Cummins (CMI +2.24%) engines to making its own.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • S

    Sprint (S -2.1%) is under pressure after being downgraded to Sell from Hold at Stifel...

    Sprint (S -2.1%) is under pressure after being downgraded to Sell from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus, citing excessive investor optimism about the potential of the company's Network Vision program to simplify its wireless network; the strategy may prove more complicated and take more time and money than investors anticipate. Nicolaus puts a fair value of $4.50 on the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • SNOFF

    After a 50% short-covering pop on yesterday's open, it's been a steady drip lower for...

    After a 50% short-covering pop on yesterday's open, it's been a steady drip lower for Sino-Forest (OTC:SNOFF -31%), now below the level of Friday's close. Nomura's Annisa Lee discovers (too late for her firm's clients) Sino-Forest's accounting isn't exactly conservative.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM

  • The centerpiece of Nintendo's (NTDOY.PK +1%) new "Wii-U" gaming console is a six-inch...

    The centerpiece of Nintendo's (NTDOY.PK +1%) new "Wii-U" gaming console is a six-inch touchscreen controller that can display high-quality images itself. The company had little to say about price or specs, but said it would feature high-def graphics - a sticking point for its aging Wii product. (more from E3)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • FFNT

    FriendFinder (FFN +19%) jumps on a strong Q1 with solid performance from a string of new...

    FriendFinder (FFN +19%) jumps on a strong Q1 with solid performance from a string of new websites. The stock climbs to its highest levels since shortly after its less-than-well received IPO.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • CMCSA

    NBC (CMCSA +1.5%) has reportedly retained rights to broadcast the Olympic Games in a four-games...

    NBC (CMCSA +1.5%) has reportedly retained rights to broadcast the Olympic Games in a four-games deal through 2020 worth more than $4B. NBC's had every summer games since 1988, and the winter games since 2002.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • CVC

    Cablevision (CVC +5.4%) outpacing its industry peers today after approving a June 30 spin-off of...

    Cablevision (CVC +5.4%) outpacing its industry peers today after approving a June 30 spin-off of AMC Networks - the former Rainbow Media, including channels AMC, WE TV, IFC and Sundance Channel. The new concern will trade as AMCX on Nasdaq and start out with $2.43B in debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +8.5%) soars as positive data is released on its phase II study of the...

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +8.5%) soars as positive data is released on its phase II study of the potential blockbuster Btk inhibitor. The stock's a blockbuster itself, up nearly 60% since hitting a 52-week low in early March.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • NYX

    NYSE Euronext (NYX +0.7%) briefly halted as it and Deutsche Boerse (DBOEY.PK +1%) announce a...

    NYSE Euronext (NYX +0.7%) briefly halted as it and Deutsche Boerse (DBOEY.PK +1%) announce a €2 one-time dividend to be paid out shortly after the two close on their merger. Being able to do so "underscores the strength" of the combination, NYX chief Duncan Niederauer says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks Solutions (SWKS +7.2%) bounces after affirming its Q3 outlook. Despite the strong move,...

    Skyworks Solutions (SWKS +7.2%) bounces after affirming its Q3 outlook. Despite the strong move, the stock has yet to break its downtrend, off more than 20% since the beginning of May.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • SUN

    Morgan Stanley says higher coal production and continued restructuring at Sunoco (SUN +4.75%)...

    Morgan Stanley says higher coal production and continued restructuring at Sunoco (SUN +4.75%) offer opportunities for expansion. The bank raises its FY12 EPS estimates to $3.27 from $2.98, and ups its price target to $53 from $50.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • BAP

    "The new president is likely to end up opting for policy prudence," says Credit Suisse, joining...

    "The new president is likely to end up opting for policy prudence," says Credit Suisse, joining Nomura in calling the selloff in Peru a buying opportunity. Shares are bouncing following yesterday's drubbing. EPU +3.0%, BAP +6.2%, BVN +1.4%, SCCO +1.0%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 2 Comments
  • FGP

    Ferrellgas Partners (NYSE:FGP): FQ3 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.23. Revenue of $732M (+19% Y/Y)...

    Ferrellgas Partners (NYSE:FGP): FQ3 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.23. Revenue of $732M (+19% Y/Y) beats by $53M. Q3 results "reflected similar dynamics from the first half of the fiscal year, notably sharply higher wholesale propane prices that drove customer conservation." Shares -5.9%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI) +7% on reports it will supply 90% of the total CMOS image sensor orders...

    OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI) +7% on reports it will supply 90% of the total CMOS image sensor orders placed by Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) for the fifth generation iPhone. Sony (SNE -1.3%) will reportedly supply the other 10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • PBY-OLD

    Pep Boys (PBY-OLD -16.3%) gets clobbered after Q1 earnings come up short. The company blames the...

    Pep Boys (PBY-OLD -16.3%) gets clobbered after Q1 earnings come up short. The company blames the usual suspects - poor weather and higher fuel costs - for crimping spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (LDK +2.1%) pops after closing a $240M deal to sell a minority stake in its...

    LDK Solar (LDK +2.1%) pops after closing a $240M deal to sell a minority stake in its polysilicon manufacturing business to China Development Bank.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • MIND

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND) Q1 EPS $0.58 beats by $0.24. Sales of $26.5M beats by $4.78M....

    Mitcham Industries (NASDAQ:MIND) Q1 EPS $0.58 beats by $0.24. Sales of $26.5M beats by $4.78M. Earnings for Q1 more than doubled on strong demand from Canada and Russia, as well as improvement in the U.S. Shares +13% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • TIN

    Temple-Inland (TIN +42%) rolls out a stockholder rights plan and declares a dividend of one...

    Temple-Inland (TIN +42%) rolls out a stockholder rights plan and declares a dividend of one preferred share warrant for each common share - a move it says will assure that all stockholders receive fair treatment in the event of a takeover, and guard against abusive tactics "to gain control of Temple-Inland without paying all stockholders a premium for that control." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • TLB

    Talbots (NYSE:TLB): Q1 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $301M (-6% Y/Y) misses by $4M....

    Talbots (NYSE:TLB): Q1 EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $301M (-6% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Says Q2 sales and traffic continue to trend negative, with top-line sales down "low-teens" Y/Y. Expects high levels of promotions and markdowns to continue, driving margins lower. Shares -29.7% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • TIN

    Premarket gainers: TIN +43%. BZ +10%. AEZS +8%. IP +5%. SWKS +5%. LPX +5%. IRE +4%. LDK +3%....

    Premarket gainers: TIN +43%. BZ +10%. AEZS +8%. IP +5%. SWKS +5%. LPX +5%. IRE +4%. LDK +3%. GERN +3%. RIO +3%. STKL +3%. MT +3%. SOLR +3%. BCS +3%. ING +3%.
    Losers: TLB -29%. CLF -3%. CTXS -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • CTXS

    Citrix Systems (NASDAQ:CTXS) gets cut to Underweight from Neutral at both Jefferies and...

    Citrix Systems (NASDAQ:CTXS) gets cut to Underweight from Neutral at both Jefferies and JPMorgan. Says Jefferies: "...current valuations assume overly optimistic market adoption rates of desktop virtualization technology... we think the intrinsic value of CTXS shares is well below what is implied in the current share price." Shares -2.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • TIF

    The big rumor today in London is that Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) is being sought by Cartier owner...

    The big rumor today in London is that Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) is being sought by Cartier owner Richemont (OTCPK:CFRUY) for something like $130/share. TIF has been on a tear since sparkling Q4 results on March 21 followed by an equally strong Q1 on May 26. TIF +2.7% premarket to $74.70.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • INGR

    Corn Products (CPO) gets bumped up to Buy from Hold at Deutsche Bank, which believes the company...

    Corn Products (CPO) gets bumped up to Buy from Hold at Deutsche Bank, which believes the company has successfully transitioned to a "more diversified, ingredients-based model" which will enable "more company-driven growth (not solely based on macro trends) over time, enhancing valuation." Shares +2.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto (RIO +3.1%) says it's on track to produce over 240M tons of iron ore this year....

    Rio Tinto (RIO +3.1%) says it's on track to produce over 240M tons of iron ore this year. Looking ahead, it targets output of 283M tons by mid-2013 and 333M tons by mid-2015, and says 'early studies are underway' for boosting that number to 433M tons.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 AM
